name: Drunken Ribs
author: CHEF BOOZER
summary: This recipe is one my favorites, it is one I found one day when I was experimenting. My family and friends enjoyed it and I hope you will too!
ingredients: 12 (12 fluid ounce) cans or bottles premium lager
directions: In a medium bowl, mix garlic powder, white pepper, seasoned salt, onion salt, and oregano
Place ribs in a large roasting pan, and rub evenly with the garlic powder mixture to coat
Pour distilled white vinegar and 1/2 the beer, or enough to cover ribs, into the pan
Cover pan, and marinate ribs in the refrigerator 8 hours, or overnight
Prepare an outdoor grill for indirect, medium heat, and lightly oil grate
In a large saucepan, whisk together remaining beer, ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, maple syrup, brown sugar, liquid smoke, margarine, apple cider vinegar, and honey mustard
Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 15 minutes, or until a thick sauce has formed
Remove ribs from the marinade mixture, and coat liberally with the sauce
Place on the prepared grill, and cook 1 1/2 to 2 hours, to an internal temperature of 160 degrees F (70 degrees C)
Brush frequently with the sauce while cooking
